titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files ARC.315
titlestmt.author: Lena Evers-Hillstrom and Michael Chui, under the supervision of Maggie Schreiner and John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-20 22:00:33 +0000.

did.abstract: The Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files is an artificial collection compiled by Brooklyn Historical Society staff, that continues to be updated to the present day. The collection contains pamphlets, cards, advertisements, newspaper articles, magazines, letters, and more dating from 1770 to the present documenting Brooklyn, New York City, and Long Island. This collection also includes biographical files on notable Brooklyn individuals.
did.langmaterial: The majority of the materials in English, with additional materials in Spanish, German, Dutch, and Hebrew.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files is an artificial collection compiled by the Brooklyn Historical Society staff, that continues to be updated to the present day.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into three series: Series 1. New York City and Long Island, Series 2. Brooklyn, Series 3. Biographical.
Series 1 and 2 are arranged alphabetically by topic, while Series 3 is organized alphabetically by last name.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files is an artificial collection compiled by Brooklyn Historical Society staff, that continues to be updated to the present day.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Historical Society Vertical Files collection, ARC.315, Drawer number and Folder name; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Twenty boxes of material found in repository added to collection by Lena Evers-Hillstrom in September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains pamphlets, cards, advertisements, newspaper articles, magazines, letters, and more dating from 1770 to the present. The first series documents life in New York City and Long Island, including individual communities, organizations, and events. This series includes materials on counties and boroughs such as Queens, Staten Island, and Suffolk County. The second series documents life in Brooklyn through files on individual neighborhoods, landscapes, organizations, events, local government, and businesses. The third series documents individuals from Brooklyn and Brooklyn-based families. Notable individuals represented in this collection include Walt Whitman, Henry Ward Beecher, Gabriel Furman, Jackie Robinson, and members of the Roebling and Shellens families. This collection also includes information about lesser known organizations and individuals.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: All works published prior to 1923 are in the public domain. The copyright status for all other materials has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
